Articles.Content: so, I want to make a mod, that has fairings,engines, and couplers. how would I make the mod? and the textures? any recomendations for someone with zero experience?

zero experience... as in no 3D, no Texturing, no Unity experience? or zero experience as in know some 3d/texture; just never made anything for KSP?

if latter: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/94638-New-Mod-Development-Links-Compilation

if former I suggest starting with some basic 3D tutorials with blender and put modding off for a while.

Edited December 11, 2014 by nli2work

very,very,very little experience in 3d(except some experience in Google sketch-up),absolutely none in Texturing (plan on plain white parts) don't got any unity experience except playing ksp, adding mods, and online games.
I suggest taking some time to get familiar with Blender making some simple KSP parts like fuel tanks and probe cores. the link above have all the information you need.

Its not a simple process. Its like if someone said, I would like to build a house and I dont have any tools or experience. I have lived in a house how hard can it be.

So your first step should be build a really small house with simple tools.

I suggest you just make a small simple fuel tank first and get that in the game to start with.

If you start off trying to make a Star Destroyer or an exact replica of ISS, you will be overwhelmed very quickly and end up hating it.

Free, open source image editing software, kind of like Photoshop.

http://www.gimp.org/

Also I highly recommenced actually downloading Photoshop CS2. It is now offered for free from Adobe.

http://www.digitaltrends.com/computing/how-to-get-photoshop-for-free/

Blender another free open source modeling program

http://www.blender.org/

Again I highly recommend learning a professional product either 3Ds Max or Maya

Max and maya both have a version that is free for students.

http://www.autodesk.com/education/free-software/3ds-max

http://www.autodesk.com/education/free-software/maya

And of course Unity, basic version is free and good enough for modding KSP.

http://unity3d.com/unity/download

A guide for various tutorials in KSP and part tools.
